revised_title: Planetary Waves on a Rotating Sphere: Analyzing Tidal Equations
tldr: This paper investigates low-frequency solutions to the tidal equations on a rotating sphere, focusing on planetary waves that depend on the variation of planetary vorticity with latitude. The author shows that the equations reduce to the spheroidal wave equation, and discusses the validity of the -plane approximation. The study also extends to internal (baroclinic) waves and suggests that some deep currents observed in the Atlantic may be planetary waves at the cutoff period.
